intro: Talisia, commonly known as the yellow bell or yellow woodbine, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apocynaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are shrubs or small trees native to the Americas. The plants are characterized by their showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. They have opposite, simple leaves and produce berries that contain toxic seeds. Talisia species are often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in a variety of habitats including forests and open woodlands.
